greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of divisors of n that are fundamental discriminants.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16385
example: 10 has divisors 1, 2, 5 and 10 of which 1 and 5 are fundamental discriminants, so a(10)=2
program: (PARI) A086669(n) = sumdiv(n, i, isfundamental(i)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 22 2017
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Jul 27 2003
